name: TWIN STAR INN
detail: Value for money stay with clean rooms and facilities.
area: Taipei Main Station,Taipei - View on map

name: citizenM Taipei North Gate
detail: I have to say I am in love with the big windows it has in all the rooms. As you may notice, a lot of the Taipei hotels do not have windows in their room yet this one you can enjoy a great view of the busy Taipei. Besides, they have an iPad that allows you to control everything in the room with an app. Though you don't see the usual smart/butt-washing toilet but you get the smart lighting in your shower area in return. All in all, it's a nicely designed hotel which is also a good value for money. An obvious choice in the Taipei Station area.

name: Goodmore Hotel
detail: Great stay. - near bus stops (Taiwan bus transportation is easy, google map, bus tracker taiwan is a recommended app for guides) A little walk to get to train stations (most convenient is Guting station exit 5 as it is straight walk, however if you want to explore the neighborhood, exit thru Dongmen station - shops are around these walk) Near Ximen station which we fully utilized as we go there every night to shop :D) Near most stations we often go to for sightseeing so it was super easy for us as DIY tourist The staffs are super accomodating!!!!! Just let them know of your needs, they are super nice! There is also a free breakfast buffet!!! Mind you in every night of your stay, your next day bfast is free! (Budget friendly~~) They clean and change towels every day (you have options to change sheets if you want to) They have english channels in TV, :D PS: shout out to Ms Cathy M who helps us with our wifi ordeal (we had issue with our rented wifi router from klook so they lend us wifi router for free!!!)

name: MEANDER Taipei
detail: This has been my fourth trip to Taipei, and I have always love the place. What makes this place special is Meander, and the warmth they have provided. I have been coming here since my first trip and they always are great. Not only are the venues worth the price, the staff are very open-minded, and the people gathering here seem to be likewise, because of the atmosphere the staffs make. I recommend a long stay here to make great friends during your stay in Taiwan.

name: Palais de Chine Hotel
detail: i truely enjoyed staying at palais de chine! i have stayed 5 star hotels in taipei,however palais de chine was way better! great location makes it easier to access to any places in taipei. staffs were very friendly and helpful. they recognized the staying guests and try to assist you as much as possible. hotel decor was great as well. usually hotels are very bright, but palais de chine was very dark. i enjoyed this unique atomosphere. room was the best! i especially liked the bath tub. it was huge! and decor of the room was nothing like other hotels. i actually enjoyed the time staying in my room the most during my taipei trip! plais de chine is recommended for couples or single traveler!
area: Taipei Main Station,Taipei - View on map

name: Just Live Hostel
detail: By far this is the best hostel I have ever stayed in.
area: Taipei Main Station,Taipei - View on map

name: Poshpacker Hotel
detail: I stayed at women's floor. Among lots of hotel in Taipei, the most important thing to me is the cleaness and easy access to station. This hotel is not only good location but also it was very clean and tidy. The room & bed was compact, but to me, there was no problem. I could stay so pleasantly. The first floor is coffee shop; wake up, go down stair, get a cup of offee easily, it is very nice. Around the hotel, there are food shops, book store and department store. You have got lots options to go&eat.
area: Taipei Main Station,Taipei - View on map

name: Caesar Park Hotel
detail: Hotel's location is probably one of the best in Taipei being situated above Taipei Main Station MRT and having its own dedicated exit (M6). Hotel is at the more expensive end of the range of Taipei hotels but I felt I achieved decent value for money all considering. Room for a couple was perfectly adequate, though did not appear as large as some photos I had seen in advertising. However this might have been due to the enormous bathroom taking a fair amount of the room space. I would neither describe the room as dated or modern, somewhere in between, but comfortable and always clean. Air conditioning was very good and quiet in operation. Breakfast was buffet style and comprehensive; I was very happy with it, the fruit juices were some of the best I have tasted. Staff need a special mention as they were consistently delightful, polite, friendly and always helpful (they could speak English though my partner can speak Chinese). Overall a very pleasant 8 day stay and I would visit again.
area: Taipei Main Station,Taipei - View on map

name: Wonderwall Ximending
detail: The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are very clean.

name: Colormix Hotel and Hostel
detail: Stayed in this Hotel over the weekend. One thing that is recommendable about this hotel is its staff. All are very accommodating and approachable. They don't hesitate to provide tips and information about the city. Need extra water/coffee? They won't mind you requesting for refill :) Location is very good around 5mins away from MRT Ximen station and Ximending Shopping area. We arrived at Taoyuan International Airport Terminal 1 around 1230am, so the accessible MRT connections were already closed (until 11pm only). We took the bus (Bus#1819) going to Taipei Main Station @ NT$125/pax (US$4), travel time approximately 1hr. From there we took a 10mins taxi to the hotel (just show the driver the address). Taxi fare NT$150. If MRT is still open, go to Ximen Station Exit 1 or 6 (there should be a visible WATSONS store on the right). Follow the Chungdu road (50m) straight ahead look for Shanghai Commercial Savings (left side of the road) or Bank of Sinopac (right side of the road), turn left @ Neijiang Street. Colormix is already a few meters on the right. A lot of street foods to discover around the area as well. Taiwanese people are friendly in general, (unlike HK people, sorry) Going back to Taoyuan Airport, you can take the new Airport MRT (half price promo as of Mar2017 NT$80) via Taipei Main Station. Overall, had a great stay at this hotel, though WIFI connection occasionally lag in our room. Hope this can be improved. Tip: Not a lot of money changer in Taipei. Make sure you have some NT$ before you come to Taiwan. Recommended money changer is thru Bank of Taiwan (not bank of Taipei) since they don't collect fees and rates are batter. Don't forget t bring your passport. Worst case if banks are already closed, there is a money changer inside the mall beside Exit 1 of Ximen Station.
